definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to exhaust
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: We will be dedicated for you to develop new markets, achieve a win-win situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们会尽心竭力为你们开拓市场，实现双赢。

sentences.english: So earnest an effort was well deserving of a better reward.
sentences.chinese: 尽心竭力，照理应该得到较好的结果。

sentences.english: The authorities say they are working hard to protect the temples.
sentences.chinese: 当局表示，他们尽心竭力来保护这些庙宇。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
with all of one's heart
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to offer one's life in sacrifice
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
to do one's utmost
responsible and diligent (idiom)
not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to spare no effort
